Pronouns - Indefinites A final type of pronouns is indefinites. There are two basic sets of indefinite pronouns, though not all languages merge them into a single word:
those consisting of a quantifier and an indefinite generic noun, such as one (person or thing), everybody, everything, everyone, anybody, anything, anyone, somebody, something, someone, and
those built from an word, such as whoever and whatever.
Beginning with the first type above that includes a quantifier, such as ‘everybody’, ‘anything’ and ‘someone’ (or the impersonal use of the number ‘one’), how does your language express these indefinites? Check all options that are correct for your language. If your language does not have this type of indefinite, leave all these options unchecked and select the option for ‘None’ below.
